not_P.title: Will Tyson Fury defeat Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
not_P.body: The question resolves Yes if Tyson Fury wins the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk, meaning Usyk loses. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Tyson Fury fails to overcome Oleksandr Usyk and secure the title of Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
para_P.body: The inquiry concludes with a Yes if Tyson Fury loses the boxing match to Oleksandr Usyk, which includes scenarios where Usyk emerges victorious or if the result is a draw. Additionally, if there is no confrontation between these two fighters prior to May 19th, 2024, the question will be rendered void.

para_P.title: Is Tyson Fury going to triumph over Oleksandr Usyk to claim the title of Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
para_P.body: The outcome will be Yes if Tyson Fury secures victory in the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk. It will be No if Usyk emerges victorious or if the match ends in a draw. If the two fighters do not compete against each other prior to May 19th, 2024, the question will be void.

not_P.title: Is Tyson Fury not going to triumph over Oleksandr Usyk to claim the title of Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
not_P.body: The outcome will be Yes if Tyson Fury does not secure victory in the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk. It will be No if Fury emerges victorious or if the match ends in a draw. If the two fighters do not compete against each other prior to May 19th, 2024, the question will be void.

para_P.title: Will Tyson Fury defeat Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
para_P.body: The answer will be Yes if Tyson Fury wins the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk. It will be No if Usyk wins or if the fight results in a draw. If the two boxers do not face each other before May 19th, 2024, the question will be considered invalid.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

metadata.background_info:
In early January 2024, Rep. Bill Johnson communicated to the Governor of Ohio that he would be vacating his congressional seat effective of the 21st of January 2024 in order to take up position as the 10th President of Youngstown State University. 

On the 4th of January, [Governor DeWine announced ] (https://governor.ohio.gov/media/news-and-media/governor-dewine-calls-special-election-for-ohios-6th-congressional-district) that the special election process was scheduled as followed: partisan primary elections will happen on the 19th of March, and the general election will happen on the 11th June 2024.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Republican Party to keep Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly occupied by Bill Johnson) in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that an individual affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where mainstream sources conflict, an authoritative Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. If there is no election conducted prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it true that the Republican Party will lose Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly held by Bill Johnson) in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if reliable sources indicate that no candidate representing the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If the election does not take place prior to January 1, 2025, the inquiry will be considered void.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Republican Party to keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

not_P.title: Is it not possible for the Republican Party to keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
not_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that no candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If an election takes place before January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

para_P.title: Can the Republican Party maintain its hold on Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the special election set for 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a Yes response if credible sources confirm that a Republican Party candidate has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In instances where there are conflicting reports from popular sources, an official source or statement from the state of Ohio will be used as reference. If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, this inquiry will be deemed invalid.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

metadata.background_info:
The most serious attack occurred at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, Germany.  Five of the hostage takers were killed, along with eleven members of the Israeli Olympic Team and one West German policeman.
At the 1996 Summer Olympics in Atlanta, a bombing at the Centennial Olympic Park resulted in one death and over 100 injuries.  This was classified as domestic terrorism. [Centennial Olympic Park bombing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centennial_Olympic_Park_bombing)
At the 2008 Olympics in Beijing, a knife attack at a Beijing market left [three people dead and over 60 injured]((https://www.start.umd.edu/news/olympics-and-terrorism). Although it did not occur during the 1988 Olympics in Seoul, Korea, the bombing of Korean Air Flight 858 on November 29, 1987 was [considered to be a terrorist attack by North Korea]( https://www.history.com/news/1988-seoul-olympics-north-korea-terrorist-attack) in an attempt to get the Olympics moved from Seoul.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The resolution of this question will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The resolution will be No if this scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French governmental agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will at least one terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if at least one terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Will there be no acts of terrorism in metropolitan France throughout the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be Yes if there are no terrorist incidents in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) that result in injuries or fatalities to anyone other than the perpetrators, during the period from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The resolution will be No if such an incident occurs.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official entity of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the inquiry will be answered negatively if the aforementioned scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is identified as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

not_P.title: Is there no possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if no terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the inquiry will be answered negatively if the aforementioned scenario occurs.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is identified as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

para_P.title: Could there be a terrorist event occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a positive response if a terrorist event in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) leads to injuries and/or deaths of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), from the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). On the other hand, the question will be answered negatively if this situation does not take place.

An event will be recognized as a 'terrorist event' if it is classified as such by any official body of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is unavailable. If not, the market will result in a "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win 21 Gold Medals or More at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 gold medals or more at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 gold medals or more prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Secure Less Than 21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes, as a group, achieve fewer than 21 gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution source will be the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) in the absence of IOC reporting. Otherwise, the market will be resolved to "No". 

If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won fewer than 21 gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

para_P.title: Are Individual Neutral Athletes Expected to Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not accessible. If not, the market will be resolved to "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have earned 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

not_P.title: Are Individual Neutral Athletes Expected to Achieve Fewer than 21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
not_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure fewer than 21 gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not accessible. If it is not confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have earned 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will be resolved to "No".

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have earned fewer than 21 gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Secure 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will be settled with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively earn 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics. The final decision will rely on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's data is unavailable. If they do not reach this number, the market will be resolved to "No". 

If it is verified that Individual Neutral Athletes have achieved 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will promptly be resolved to "Yes".

question.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.background_info:
On April 1, 2024, an Israeli airstrike [targeted the Iranian embassy](https://apnews.com/article/israel-syria-airstrike-iranian-embassy-edca34c52d38c8bc57281e4ebf33b240) in Damascus, Syria, resulting in significant casualties including the deaths of top Iranian commanders. 

In the aftermath, the United States has increased its security posture in the region, anticipating a retaliatory strike by Iran against Israeli or American assets. Senior U.S. and Israeli officials [consider such an attack "inevitable."](https://www.cnn.com/2024/04/05/politics/us-israel-iran-retaliation-strike/index.html)

not_P.title: Will Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Iran will execute a lethal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable information suggests that an assault linked to Iran and taking place within the territory of Israel has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

not_P.title: Will Iran not carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Iran will refrain from executing a lethal assault inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are no reliable accounts suggesting that an assault linked to Iran occurring within Israel has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Iran will execute a lethal strike inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an attack linked to Iran occurring within the territory of Israel has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

not_P.title: Is there no possibility that Iran will execute a lethal strike inside Israel prior to May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an attack linked to Iran occurring within the territory of Israel has resulted in the fatalities of fewer than five people.

para_P.title: Could Iran potentially carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if, following the release date of this inquiry and prior to May 1, 2024, credible information indicates that an assault associated with Iran has taken place on Israeli soil, leading to the deaths of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"}}>
</iframe>

metadata.background_info:
The [Israeli invasion of the Gaza Strip](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli_invasion_of_the_Gaza_Strip_(2023–present)#27_October) commenced on October 27, 2023 in response to a [Hamas-led attack on Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2023_Hamas-led_attack_on_Israel) on October 7, 2023 which saw over a thousand killed, and hundreds kidnapped.

The invasion was initially limited to Northern Gaza, but the plans were gradually expanded further South. Recently, Israel has [stated its intentions to expand its invasion to the Southern city of Rafah](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-02-12/israel-conducts-strikes-in-rafah-as-humanitarian-concerns-mount), which borders Egypt. These expansion plans, like prior ones, have seen widespread condemnation from both pro and anti-Israeli nations. This condemnation is primarily based on the alarming number of deaths and casualties stemming from the ground invasion; the growing humanitarian crisis, which has become more acute as the Israeli invasion has expanded; and the vast number of Palestinian refugees which are reportedly taking refuge in the city having fled from Northern Gaza.

Israel has already [commenced airstrikes and covert raids in Rafah](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-02-12/israel-conducts-strikes-in-rafah-as-humanitarian-concerns-mount), but a full-scale ground invasion has yet to commence.

Amongst the nations who have condemned the plans are the US - Israel's closest ally - and Egypt - Gaza's Southern neighbour which [has threatened](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/02/11/egypt-threatens-to-suspend-key-peace-treaty-if-israel-pushes-into-rafah-on-its-border-officials-say.html) to break it's 45 year old peace treaty with Israel if the ground invasion plans commence in Rafah.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has continued to state that an invasion is imminent and that Israel has a specific date set, though on April 9 it [was reported](https://www.axios.com/2024/04/09/israel-defense-gallant-deny-rafah-invasion-date) that Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has said there is no date set.

not_P.title: Will Israel not expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) indicates Israeli military actions on its map at any of six identified sites around Rafah (the exact sites are detailed in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"></iframe>

not_P.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) does not report Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"></iframe>

not_P.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"></iframe>

para_P.title: Will Israel refrain from broadening its ground offensive to include the city of Rafah prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) does not indicate any Israeli military activities on its map at any of the six specified sites around Rafah (the precise locations are illustrated in the embedded map below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

question.title: Will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

metadata.background_info:
The Eurovision Song Contest 2024 is set to take place in Malmö, Sweden, following the country's victory at the 2023 contest. The contest will be held at the Malmö Arena, and will consist of two semi-finals on 7 and 9 May, and a final on 11 May 2024.

Of the 37 participating countries, 6 are guaranteed to participate in the final: The hosting country (Sweden) and the "Big Five" countries (United Kingdom, France, Germany, Italy and Spain). The remaining 31 countries will have to compete in the Semi-finals. In each Semi-final, 10 countries will qualify for the final, and the rest will not.

More information can be found on [Wikipedia](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/21827/countries-in-eurovision-2024-final/)

See also: [How the Eurovision Song Contest works](https://eurovision.tv/about/how-it-works)

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.background_info: In a significant escalation of regional tensions, [Iran launched a coordinated aerial attack targeting Israeli territory on April 13, 2024](https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/iran-tries-to-calibrate-response-against-israel-after-deadly-bombing-abb38b57). This action by Iran came as a direct retaliation for an [Israeli airstrike earlier in the month](https://apnews.com/article/israel-syria-airstrike-iranian-embassy-edca34c52d38c8bc57281e4ebf33b240#:~:text=An%20Israeli%20airstrike%20in%20a,at%20least%20five%20Iranian%20advisers.), which struck the Iranian Embassy complex in Damascus, Syria, which resulted in the deaths of seven Iranian officers, including three high-ranking commanders, intensifying Iran's resolve to respond.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, credible information emerges confirming that an assault linked to Israel has taken place within Iran's territory, resulting in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it unlikely that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, there are no reliable reports suggesting that an assault attributed to Israel taking place within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is posed and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran, resulting in the fatalities of at least five people.

not_P.title: Is there no possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date this question is posed and before May 1, 2024, there are no reliable reports suggesting that an assault linked to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran, resulting in the fatalities of at least five people.

para_P.title: Could Israel potentially carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if, following the date this question is asked and before May 1, 2024, credible information indicates that an attack associated with Israel has occurred in Iran, leading to the deaths of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

metadata.background_info:
The commencement of Donald Trump's [trial in the so-called "hush money" case](https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/4589001-5-things-to-know-ahead-of-trumps-hush-money-trial/) marks a historic moment as he becomes the first former U.S. president to face criminal charges in court. The trial centers around allegations that Trump, during the 2016 presidential campaign, orchestrated a hush money payment to an adult film actress to prevent damaging stories from surfacing. This payment, and similar transactions, are claimed by the Manhattan district attorney to have been unlawfully logged as legal expenses by Trump’s company.

The trial is scheduled to commence on April 15th, 2024 and is expected to last approximately six weeks.

*This question is part of the Q2 2024 Quarterly Cup, however, if the trial has not concluded when the tournament ends on July 8, 2024, it will not be scored in the Quarterly Cup. It will still count as part of the annual leaderboard.*

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that Donald Trump will not take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has refrained from testifying, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has not given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or through remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the purported "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

metadata.background_info:
When it comes to separatism and Moldova, most will likely recall Transnistria, which is controlled by separatists and elements of the Russian Federation armed forces since the 1990s.

However, another autonomous region of Moldova, [Gagauzia](https://www.clingendael.org/pub/2022/walking-the-tightrope-towards-the-eu/4-gagauzia-the-restless-region-in-the-south/), is currently undergoing major "temptation" from Russia. The region, inhabited by over 120,000 Gagauzes, who are an Orthodox, mostly Russian speaking Moldovan minority, is newly connected to the Mir banking system, Russian [propaganda](https://dfrlab.org/2024/03/19/kremlin-media-blitz-gagauzia/) is widely spreading (most TV channels are Russian), and control of the [Chisinau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chi%C8%99in%C4%83u) government is openly challenged.

The most important figure in this new development is Evghenia Guțul, a young pro-Russian politician, who was [elected](https://www.rferl.org/a/gutul-gagauzia-moldova-leader-shor-party/32412419.html) a governor of the region in the last year's elections, which brought a lot of controversy due to allegations of corruption and the fact that Guțul ran on a ticket of a banned Pro-Russian party (connected to the Russian oligarch Ilan Shor).

Guțul visited Russia twice in the last several weeks. The most recent [visit](https://balkaninsight.com/2024/04/10/moldovas-restive-gagauzia-region-mulls-using-russian-payment-cards/) occurred on the 8th of April, and before that on the 6th of March, during which she [met](https://balkaninsight.com/2024/03/07/pro-moscow-governor-of-moldovas-gagauzia-seeks-putins-help/) with Russian President Vladimir Putin (edit May 6, 2024: Guțul also appears to have been in Moscow when this question was launched, with a [meeting in Moscow on April 22](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldova-brings-criminal-case-against-pro-russian-gagauzia-leader-court-2024-04-24/) and on [April 24](https://twitter.com/EvgheniaGutul/status/1783236723297685785)).

In the aftermath of both visits Russia promised to "protect" Gagauzia and also to distribute monthly [payments](https://cepa.org/article/the-kremlin-decides-to-buy-a-population/) to Gagauzian civil servants and senior citizens (together accounting for approximately 25,000 people).

More Guțul visits in Russia might signal rapid development in this region, which could mean further deterioration of the relationship between Gagauzia and Moldovan government.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

metadata.background_info: [Reporting suggests](https://www.politico.eu/article/russian-victory-over-ukranian-key-city-chasiv-yar-jeopardize-entire-donetsk-region/) that the Ukrainian military sees the city of Chasiv Yar as strategically significant, and that the capture of the city could jeopardize the remaining key cities in the [Donetsk oblast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast). Ukraine has [reportedly said](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/why-is-russia-trying-capture-ukrainian-town-chasiv-yar-2024-04-16/) that Russia aims to capture the city by May 9.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

metadata.background_info:
In April 29, 2024, Axios [reported](https://www.axios.com/2024/04/29/netanyahu-biden-icc-arrest-warrants-war-crimes) that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asked US President Joe Biden to help prevent the International Criminal Court (ICC) in The Hague from issuing arrest warrants for Israeli cabinet officials stemming from possible allegations of war crimes in Gaza. NBC [reported](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-fears-icc-issue-arrest-warrants-netanyahu-gaza-war-hamas-rcna149739) that these arrest warrants could come as early as this week, and Israel is working through back channels to try to prevent them from being issued. The US and other G7 countries are [reportedly](https://www.timesofisrael.com/report-several-nations-urging-icc-not-to-issue-arrest-warrants-for-israelis/) campaigning to dissuade the ICC from issuing the warrants so as to avoid jeopardizing a peace deal between Israel and Hamas.

As the ICC [explains](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) on its official website, an arrest warrant is requested by the Prosecutor as part of the investigative stage before trial, especially in cases in which suspects do not appear voluntarily.

The ICC [was founded](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court) in 2002 following the wars in Rwanda and the former Yugoslavia, and it is [intended](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2024/04/29/icc-israel-warrants-gaza/) as a permanent court to investigate war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity done by individuals. It issued its first arrest warrants in 2005, and according to the AP [has issued](https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-gaza-international-criminal-court-hague-palestinians-1f683a6e2e150d91c415eb1d0a19a44d) a total of 42 arrest warrants. Last year the ICC issued arrest warrants for [Vladimir Putin](https://www.icc-cpi.int/news/situation-ukraine-icc-judges-issue-arrest-warrants-against-vladimir-vladimirovich-putin-and) and one of his government officials stemming from the ICC's investigation into the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

See Also

Base rate information at Wikipedia: [International Criminal Court investigations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Criminal_Court_investigations)

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

metadata.background_info:
The [Crimean Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_Bridge) crosses the [Kerch Strait](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerch_Strait) between the Crimean peninsula and the Russian mainland. The bridge is [approximately 12 miles long](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/may/15/putin-opens-bridge-between-crimea-and-russian-mainland) and consists of a separated four-lane road bridge and a two-track rail bridge. Since the Russian invasion of Ukraine the Crimean Bridge has been [attacked three times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_Bridge#Attacks_during_the_Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine), with attacks successfully damaging the bridge in October of 2022 and July of 2023, and the third attack failing to strike the bridge in August of 2023.

In April of 2024 there were reports that Ukraine is planning another attack on the Crimean Bridge. On April 4, 2024, [The Guardian reported](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/apr/03/ukraine-eyes-kerch-bridge-crimea-drone-attack):

>The HUR [[Defense Intelligence of Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Directorate_of_Intelligence_(Ukraine))] thinks it can disable the bridge soon. “We will do it in the first half of 2024,” one official told the Guardian, adding that Kyrylo Budanov, the head of the main directorate of intelligence, already had “most of the means to carry out this goal”. He was following a plan approved by Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, to “minimise” Russia’s naval presence in the Black Sea.

On April 26, 2024, [Newsweek reported](https://www.newsweek.com/ukraine-decoy-missiles-crimea-bridge-attack-rybar-1894639) that an attack could coincide with Russian President Vladimir Putin's [May 7 inauguration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Russian_presidential_election#:~:text=He%20is%20scheduled%20to%20be%20inaugurated%20on%207%20May%202024.):

>[Telegram channel] Rybar said an attack on the Kerch Bridge could happen before the inauguration of Putin on May 7. The Russian leader last month secured his fifth term in office.
>
>"Considering the love of the Ukrainian authorities and their curators for symbolism, the target once again may be the Crimean Bridge, the attention to which is very high," Rybar said.
>
>The analysis comes after Russian military expert Vladislav Shurygin said on state TV that he believes Ukraine will attack the Kerch Strait Bridge on May 7.

reformat_metaculus_question.original_question: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before the listed dates? (July 1, 2024)
reformat_metaculus_question.original_body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, no [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Will there be an attack on the Crimean Bridge prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and before the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that might represent a genuine risk to the bridge's structural integrity.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, no [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, at least one [credible source](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) reports that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Crimean Bridge remains untouched by any attacks prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and preceding the specified date, no [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that might jeopardize the structural soundness of the bridge.

para_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge experience an assault prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, between May 2, 2024, and the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly endanger the structural integrity of the bridge.

not_P.title: Will the Crimean Bridge not experience an assault prior to July 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, between May 2, 2024, and the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has not been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly endanger the structural integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Crimean Bridge will be attacked before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if, from May 2, 2024, up until the mentioned date, [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been subjected to gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could severely threaten the bridge's structural stability.

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

metadata.background_info:
On May 6, 2024, Columbia University [cancelled](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/05/06/columbia-commencement-ceremony-protest-live-updates/73583447007/) its main commencement ceremony, opting instead to honor its graduates in 19 smaller ceremonies for each of its colleges. The decision was made in response to pro-Palestinian protests that erupted at the university. 

UCLA has [cancelled in-person classes](https://www.cbsnews.com/losangeles/news/ucla-cancel-in-person-classes-again-after-more-israel-hamas-war-protests/) at its campus, and there has been speculation that it may cancel its main commencement as well. Its fellow southern California school, USC, recently [moved its ceremony](https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2024-05-03/usc-shores-up-campus-limits-access-before-commencement) to the LA Coliseum.

See Also: 

MSN: [Pro-Palestinian Protests Put College Commencements in Jeopardy](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/pro-palestinian-protests-put-college-commencements-in-jeopardy/ar-BB1lUU4h)

Newsweek: [Full List of Colleges Cancelling Graduation Services Amid Campus Protests](https://www.newsweek.com/columbia-cancels-graduation-ceremony-universities-palestine-protests-1897560)

USA Today: [College graduation canceled due to anti-war protests? It's happened before](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/education/2024/05/07/why-do-colleges-cancel-graduation-a-brief-history/73586349007/)

not_P.title: Will UCLA not hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) does not hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if all ceremonies begin within an hour of the scheduled time, are not moved to another location, and are held entirely in person (i.e., with graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

para_P.title: Will UCLA conduct its planned in-person graduation ceremonies for the entire university on June 14, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) proceeds with all three of its primary in-person college graduation ceremonies for the Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) at the following times and venues on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

All ceremonies must take place at the designated locations and commence within one hour of their scheduled start times. 

This question will be answered as **No** if any ceremony fails to start within an hour of the planned time, is relocated, or is conducted entirely online (i.e., without the presence of graduates, faculty, and guests in person).

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
In late 2021 member states of the World Health Organization (WHO) [began negotiating an international agreement on pandemic prevention, preparedness, and response](https://www.kff.org/global-health-policy/issue-brief/the-pandemic-agreement-what-it-is-what-it-isnt-and-what-it-could-mean-for-the-u-s), which has been known as the Pandemic Agreement or Pandemic Accord. The [goal of the agreement](https://www.who.int/news/item/01-12-2021-world-health-assembly-agrees-to-launch-process-to-develop-historic-global-accord-on-pandemic-prevention-preparedness-and-response) is to improve responsiveness to better combat future pandemics using lessons learned from the COVID-19 response.

A [round of negotiations](https://www.who.int/news/item/28-03-2024-who-member-states-agree-to-resume-negotiations-aimed-at-finalizing-the-world-s-first-pandemic-agreement) aimed at finalizing the agreement began on April 29, 2024, and are scheduled to end on May 10, 2024. The agreement is [scheduled to be considered for adoption](https://www.who.int/news/item/28-03-2024-who-member-states-agree-to-resume-negotiations-aimed-at-finalizing-the-world-s-first-pandemic-agreement) at the upcoming [Seventy-seventh World Health Assembly](https://www.who.int/about/accountability/governance/world-health-assembly/seventy-seventh) taking place May 27 to June 1, 2024.

The level of agreement needed to approve the Pandemic Agreement may depend on the final form of the agreement, [such as whether it would be considered a treaty, regulation, or resolution](https://www.kff.org/global-health-policy/issue-brief/the-pandemic-agreement-what-it-is-what-it-isnt-and-what-it-could-mean-for-the-u-s/#:~:text=What%20are%20possible%20outcomes%20of%20the%20agreement%20negotiations%3F). Politicians in some WHO member countries, including the United States, [have stated opposition](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/who-chief-urges-countries-finalise-pandemic-accord-by-deadline-2024-05-03/) to the agreement on the basis of potentially being subject to legally binding rules within the agreement.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, the Pandemic Agreement fails to receive approval in a vote, based on information from reliable sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from trustworthy sources.

not_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is not sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from trustworthy sources.

para_P.title: Is the Pandemic Agreement expected to gain endorsement at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be responded to with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is ratified by a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, according to reliable sources.

question.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will either artist release another diss track in May?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
Popular rappers Drake and Kendrick Lamar have been publicly feuding after a years-long contempt has bubbled into an all-out war, with each artist leveling enormous unsubstantiated accusations at the other. After the most recent round of the beef, with the release of Kendrick's "Not Like Us" and Drake's "The Heart Part 6", many have speculated that the feud has reached a tipping point and neither artist will release any further music. Do you think it's been played out, or there's more yet?

Further Background: [Wikipedia Drake–Kendrick Lamar feud](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drake%E2%80%93Kendrick_Lamar_feud)

not_P.title: Drake vs Kendrick Lamar: will neither artist release another diss track in May?

para_P.body: The question will be answered with **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar puts out a new diss track aimed at the other artist between May 9, 2024 and June 1, 2024.

not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Drake and Kendrick Lamar: is it true that both artists will not put out another diss track in May?
para_P.body: The inquiry concludes as **Yes** if both Drake and Kendrick Lamar do not issue any further diss tracks aimed at each other after May 9, 2024 and prior to June 1, 2024.

para_P.body: The question will be answered as **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar publishes a new diss track aimed specifically at the other artist after May 9, 2024 and before June 1, 2024.

para_P.body: The response will be **Yes** if either Drake or Kendrick Lamar drops a new diss track directed at the other musician between May 9, 2024, and June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Recently, the national security advisor of the Philippines [called for the expulsion](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippine-calls-chinese-diplomats-be-expelled-disinformation-2024-05-10/) of Chinese diplomats over the leak of a telephone transcript between a Philippine admiral and Chinese officials, in which a Philippine admiral [informally agreed](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2024-05-07/china-threatens-to-release-audio-of-secret-deal-with-philippines) to certain terms about how the  Philippine Navy would resupply its personnel stationed in disputed areas.  

China and the Philippines have [overlapping claims](https://www.cfr.org/global-conflict-tracker/conflict/territorial-disputes-south-china-sea) to islands in the South China Sea, and in the past several months tensions have been increasing, with China [using](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/south-china-sea-why-are-china-philippines-tensions-heating-up-2024-04-11/) water cannons, collision and ramming tactics, and even a military-grade laser to try to stop the Philippines from resupplying its naval outposts. 

For further background please see [Philippines Considers Expelling Chinese Diplomats After Leaked Transcript](https://hotair.com/john-s-2/2024/05/10/philippines-considers-expelling-chinese-diplomats-after-leaked-audio-n3788194).

not_P.title: Will there be no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, none of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomats representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC does not expel any diplomats representing the Philippines.

- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, before June 1, 2024, one of the following four occurrences takes place, based on official announcements or [reliable reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat from the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats who is in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat from the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats who is in the Philippines. 

If none of these events are reported before that date, then this will resolve as **No**.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

para_P.body:

Should such reports emerge before this date, then the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be any diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before June 1, 2024, any of the following four occurrences take place, based on official announcements or [reliable news sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions):
