Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden remain unrecognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another applicable body) does not activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and subsequently allow the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to refrain from invoking the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolved with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

not_P.title: Will Biden not be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
not_P.body:
Resolves with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and does not allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden's own activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply.

Context: A Republican lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly recommended that Biden withdraw. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one draft would urge Biden to terminate his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to what has been reported, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden and jointly requesting that he withdraw.

For a YES resolution, it is necessary that all five individuals participate in the same collective message. If five individuals separately convey to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats communicating with Biden and requesting that he step aside will not fulfill the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does
not
cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden be in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he does not remain President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Biden is no longer the US President by the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will resolve to NO if he continues to hold the presidency until that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a NO resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President as defined by the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is not the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he is still the US President at that time.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as the Acting President) does not result in a NO resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States at the close of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time.

A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not equivalent to a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold survey participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in similar hypothetical scenarios either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the Manifold respondents reflect the broader public opinion?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he receive less than 3% more votes from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other poll asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing behind Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in hypothetical scenarios tend to perform better or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the wider population?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by less than 3% at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's percentage of votes, the formula used is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (the Democrat in question) votes + Other votes)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the percentage for poll 1 and poll 2 is less than 0.03. Otherwise, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats hypothetically considered either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls close.

The computation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The conclusion is YES if the difference between this computation for poll 1 and poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time.

para_P.title: Should Trump compete against Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, can he achieve a minimum of a 3% rise in backing from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll requires Manifold participants to indicate their choice for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for their selection of a standard Democrat on a comparable ballot.

Surveys of public opinion consistently show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while all other Democrats considered in hypothetical scenarios either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants represent the general public?

This market will result in a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are concluded.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES conclusion is reached if the difference between this calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the outcome will be NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

content.text: Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.
Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce that he is either dropping out or resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare that he is withdrawing from the race and stepping down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning, thereby not finishing his current term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have formally left office by that date. A declaration of his intention to resign will be adequate to conclude this market.

If this does not occur, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

not_P.body: Resolves YES if Joe Biden does not announce either that he is no longer running for re-election or that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must not occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. An announcement of his intention to do so would not be sufficient to resolve this market as YES. Otherwise, this market resolves YES on August 1st.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.body: This resolves to YES if Joe Biden does not state that he is withdrawing from the re-election campaign or that he will resign and not finish his current term. Such announcements must not take place before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Merely indicating his intention to do so will not be enough to resolve this market as YES. Otherwise, this market will resolve as YES on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from his position before July concludes?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he plans to resign from his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur prior to the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, but he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office before that date. A mere announcement of his plan to do so is adequate for this market to resolve positively.

If not, this market will be deemed FALSE on August 1st.

not_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will not declare his intention to withdraw from the presidential race and step down from his position before July concludes?
not_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Joe Biden does not make a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he plans to resign from his current presidential term. Such declarations must not occur prior to the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, and he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office before that date. A mere announcement of his plan to do so is not adequate for this market to resolve positively.

If he does make such a statement, this market will be deemed FALSE on August 1st.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden announce his decision to exit the presidential race and resign from his role before the end of July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Joe Biden issues a statement that he is halting his re-election campaign and intends to step down from his current presidential position. Such announcements must take place before the conclusion of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, but he does not need to have officially left his office by that date. A simple declaration of his intention to do so is sufficient for this market to resolve positively.

If he does not, this market will be classified as FALSE on August 1st.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

not_P.title: Will less than 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
not_P.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) less than 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

[image]Each month, a poll is conducted on Manifold to ascertain the collective opinion regarding advancements in AGI. In contrast to many of the markets and inquiries on Manifold, these polls will simply pose the question "has weak AGI been realized," without providing a specific definition of the term. The intention is that, given the term's broad nature, the only way to assess AI advancement is to allow participants to vote based on their individual interpretations.

Advancements have been consistent. The earlier polls are cited here:

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Response: 27)

The prior markets on this subject, which greatly underestimated Manifold's confidence in AI progress, included:

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

The phrase "Certified Fresh" is included for context (to my knowledge, it requires a score of 75% or above, but there might be additional criteria—the market strictly determines based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the original 1996 movie, directed by Lee Isaac Chung (famous for "Minari"), featuring Glen Powell (from "Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones (from "Normal People").

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will there be any break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 40”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 40”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

1) does not include "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) does not use existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

4) does not have a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) does not rebuild the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was not announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is Disney set to unveil a revamped version of the Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed YES if Disney reveals they are developing a revamped Peoplemover at D23 during the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as a revamped version of the Peoplemover, this attraction must be a ride featuring sections that offer views above Tomorrowland AND must possess at least two of the following features:

1) incorporates "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) utilizes existing Peoplemover track structure for part of the ride

3) reconstructs segments of the Peoplemover track on the same path for the new attraction

4) includes a station in the former Peoplemover station building

5) reconstructs the old Peoplemover station with approximately similar attributes and location.

This can be resolved as YES if a new ride is announced that utilizes parts of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles attraction, but would be NO if an attraction named Peoplemover is announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

4) includes a station in the former Peoplemover station building

5) reconstructs the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar features and location.

This can be deemed a YES if a new ride was announced that incorporates parts of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles attraction, but would be considered a NO if an attraction titled Peoplemover was announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

not_P.title: Is Disney not set to reveal a fresh iteration of the Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
not_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Disney does not declare they are developing a new iteration of the Peoplemover at the D23 event in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as not a new iteration of the Peoplemover, this attraction must not be a ride that features segments with views over Tomorrowland AND must not possess at least two of the following traits:

1) does not contain "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) does not utilize the existing Peoplemover track structure for part of the ride

3) does not reconstruct sections of the Peoplemover track on the same path for the new attraction

4) does not include a station in the former Peoplemover station building

5) does not reconstruct the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar features and location.

This can be deemed a YES if a new ride was announced that does not incorporate parts of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles attraction, but would be considered a NO if an attraction titled Peoplemover was announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Will Disney announce a new version of the Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as a YES if Disney reveals they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover during the D23 event at the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To qualify as a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction must be a ride that includes segments with views of Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) has "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its name

2) makes use of the existing Peoplemover track structure for part of the ride

3) rebuilds sections of the Peoplemover track along the same route for the new attraction

4) features a station in the old Peoplemover station building

5) renovates the previous Peoplemover station with roughly comparable features and location.

This can be considered a YES if a new ride was announced that includes elements of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles attraction, but would be viewed as a NO if an attraction named Peoplemover was announced that takes place entirely within a building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.
